title: Design for Printed Textile-Mikado, Series #650-654
provenance: This collection was donated to the Cooper-Hewitt, National Design Museum in 1969 by Alexander Girard
medium: Graphite and brush and watercolor on white tracing paper
description: Twenty squares of flower motifs with square centers. The inspiration for this design was the sixteen petaled chrysanthemum, the emblem of the mikado, or emperor of Japan.  The square at the center of each flower may refer to the tsuba, or ornamental sword guard.
name: Drawing
